versions.label: Introduced
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 AZ H 2342
Author: Martinez
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 01/16/2025

REFERENCE TITLE: cell phone carrier; spam calls

State of Arizona

House of Representatives

Fifty-seventh Legislature

First Regular Session

2025

HB 2342

Introduced by

Representative Martinez

AN ACT

AMENDING TITLE 44, CHAPTER 9, ARTICLE 6, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING SECTION 44-1283; RELATING TO TELEPHONE SOLICITATIONS.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 44, chapter 9, article 6, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 44-1283, to read:

44-1283. Cell phone network carrier; spam calls; civil penalty; attorney general; definitions

A. A CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER SHALL PROHIBIT:

1. SPAM CALLS FROM CONNECTING TO ANY TELEPHONE THAT IS LOCATED IN THIS STATE.

2. ANY CALL THAT ORIGINATED BY USING DIALER SOFTWARE.

B. THE CONSUMER PROTECTION DIVISION OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE SHALL CREATE A WEBSITE THAT:

1. ALLOWS AN INDIVIDUAL TO REPORT A VIOLATION OF SUBSECTION A OF THIS SECTION THAT INCLUDES HOW TO PROVIDE THE SPAM CALL NUMBER AND ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

2. ALLOWS A RESIDENT IN THIS STATE TO SUBMIT THE RESIDENT'S TELEPHONE NUMBER TO THE ARIZONA DO NOT CALL LIST AND THAT PROVIDES THE LIST TO EACH CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER ON A MONTHLY BASIS.

C. IF A CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER IS IN VIOLATION OF SUBSECTION A OF THIS SECTION, THE ATTORNEY GENERAL SHALL:

1. FOR THE FIRST VIOLATION, PROVIDE A WRITTEN WARNING.

2. FOR SUBSEQUENT VIOLATIONS, IMPOSE A $100 CIVIL PENALTY PER SPAM CALL. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS PARAGRAPH, THE ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE SHALL RETAIN $50 OF EVERY $100 COLLECTED TO MAINTAIN THE CONSUMER PROTECTION DIVISION.

D. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION:

1. "CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER" MEANS A WIRELESS SERVICE PROVIDER THAT PROVIDES CELLULAR CONNECTIVITY TO MOBILE DEVICES.

2. "DIALER SOFTWARE" MEANS A TOOL THAT AUTOMATES THE PROCESS OF MAKING CALLS TO INDIVIDUALS.


Copyright © 2025 State Net

REFERENCE TITLE: cell phone carrier; spam calls

State of Arizona

House of Representatives

Fifty-seventh Legislature

First Regular Session

2025

HB 2342

Introduced by

Representative Martinez

AN ACT

AMENDING TITLE 44, CHAPTER 9, ARTICLE 6, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING
SECTION 44-1283; RELATING TO TELEPHONE SOLICITATIONS.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 44, chapter 9, article 6, Arizona Revised Statutes, is
amended by adding section 44-1283, to read:

_44-1283._Cell phone network carrier; spam calls; civil penalty; attorney
general; definitions_ _

_A. A CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER SHALL PROHIBIT:_

_1\. SPAM CALLS FROM CONNECTING TO ANY TELEPHONE THAT IS LOCATED IN THIS
STATE._

_2\. ANY CALL THAT ORIGINATED BY USING DIALER SOFTWARE._

_B. THE CONSUMER PROTECTION DIVISION OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL 'S OFFICE SHALL
CREATE A WEBSITE THAT:_

_1\. ALLOWS AN INDIVIDUAL TO REPORT A VIOLATION OF SUBSECTION A OF THIS
SECTION THAT INCLUDES HOW TO PROVIDE THE SPAM CALL NUMBER AND ADDITIONAL
INFORMATION._

_2\. ALLOWS A RESIDENT IN THIS STATE TO SUBMIT THE RESIDENT 'S TELEPHONE
NUMBER TO THE ARIZONA DO NOT CALL LIST AND THAT PROVIDES THE LIST TO EACH CELL
PHONE NETWORK CARRIER ON A MONTHLY BASIS._

_C. IF A CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER IS IN VIOLATION OF SUBSECTION A OF THIS
SECTION, THE ATTORNEY GENERAL SHALL:_

_1\. FOR THE FIRST VIOLATION, PROVIDE A WRITTEN WARNING._

_2\. FOR SUBSEQUENT VIOLATIONS, IMPOSE A $100 CIVIL PENALTY PER SPAM CALL. FOR
THE PURPOSES OF THIS PARAGRAPH, THE ATTORNEY GENERAL 'S OFFICE SHALL RETAIN
$50 OF EVERY $100 COLLECTED TO MAINTAIN THE CONSUMER PROTECTION DIVISION._

_D. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION:_

_1. "CELL PHONE NETWORK CARRIER" MEANS A WIRELESS SERVICE PROVIDER THAT
PROVIDES CELLULAR CONNECTIVITY TO MOBILE DEVICES._

_2. "DIALER SOFTWARE" MEANS A TOOL THAT AUTOMATES THE PROCESS OF MAKING CALLS
TO INDIVIDUALS._

versions.label: Amended - Striker
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 AZ H 2342
Author: Martinez
Version: Amended - Striker
Version Date: 02/18/2025

Fifty-seventh Legislature

First Regular Session

COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE

HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES AMENDMENTS TO H.B. 2342

(Reference to printed bill)

Strike everything after the enacting clause and insert:

"Section 1. Section 9-500.42, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended to read:

9-500.42. Prohibition on regulation of using computational power or running node on blockchain technology; state preemption; definitions

A. A city or town may not prohibit or otherwise restrict an individual from LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence.

B. The regulation of the act of LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence is of statewide concern and not subject to further regulation by a city or town.

C. For the purposes of this section : ,

1. "COMPUTATIONAL POWER" MEANS THE USE OF COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO PROCESS DATA, RUN ALGORITHMS OR PERFORM TASKS REQUIRING SIGNIFICANT COMPUTING RESOURCES, INCLUDING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, BLOCKCHAIN, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND CLOUD COMPUTING.

2. "Running a node on blockchain technology" means providing computing power to validate or encrypt transactions in blockchain technology as defined in section 44-7061.

Sec. 2. Section 11-269.22, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended to read:

11-269.22. Prohibition on regulation of using computational power or running node on blockchain technology; state preemption; definitions

A. A county may not prohibit or otherwise restrict an individual from LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence.

B. The regulation of the act of LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence is of statewide concern and not subject to further regulation by a county.

C. For the purposes of this section : ,

1. "COMPUTATIONAL POWER" MEANS THE USE OF COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO PROCESS DATA, RUN ALGORITHMS OR PERFORM TASKS REQUIRING SIGNIFICANT COMPUTING RESOURCES, INCLUDING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, BLOCKCHAIN, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND CLOUD COMPUTING.

2. "Running a node on blockchain technology" means providing computing power to validate or encrypt transactions in blockchain technology as defined in section 44-7061."

Amend title to conform

And, as so amended, it do pass

JEFF WENINGER

CHAIRMAN

2342COMMERCE.docx

02/18/2025

09:15 PM

C: LAT


Copyright © 2025 State Net

HOUSE BILL 2342

AN ACT

AMENDING SECTIONS 9-500.42 AND 11-269.22, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES; RELATING TO BLOCKCHAIN TECHNOLOGY.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Section 9-500.42, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended to read:

9-500.42. Prohibition on regulation of using computational power or running node on blockchain technology; state preemption; definitions

A. A city or town may not prohibit or otherwise restrict an individual from LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence.

B. The regulation of the act of LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence is of statewide concern and not subject to further regulation by a city or town.

C. For the purposes of this section : ,

1. "COMPUTATIONAL POWER" MEANS THE USE OF COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO PROCESS DATA, RUN ALGORITHMS OR PERFORM TASKS REQUIRING SIGNIFICANT COMPUTING RESOURCES, INCLUDING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, BLOCKCHAIN, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND CLOUD COMPUTING.

2. "Running a node on blockchain technology" means providing computing power to validate or encrypt transactions in blockchain technology as defined in section 44-7061.

Sec. 2. Section 11-269.22, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended to read:

11-269.22. Prohibition on regulation of using computational power or running node on blockchain technology; state preemption; definitions

A. A county may not prohibit or otherwise restrict an individual from LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence.

B. The regulation of the act of LAWFULLY ACCESSING OR USING COMPUTATIONAL POWER OR running a node on blockchain technology in a residence is of statewide concern and not subject to further regulation by a county.

C. For the purposes of this section : ,

1. "COMPUTATIONAL POWER" MEANS THE USE OF COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO PROCESS DATA, RUN ALGORITHMS OR PERFORM TASKS REQUIRING SIGNIFICANT COMPUTING RESOURCES, INCLUDING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, BLOCKCHAIN, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND CLOUD COMPUTING.

2. "Running a node on blockchain technology" means providing computing power to validate or encrypt transactions in blockchain technology as defined in section 44-7061.

HOUSE BILL 2342
